website_summaries.verdict: Durability and maneuverability are this dog ramp's pluses. Narrow tread not ideal for larger breeds, but smaller dogs should learn to use it quickly.
pros: Fiberglass and plastic construction will not rust
Lightweight, easy for one person to set up
Popular choice for older or health-challenged dogs
cons: Very narrow tread width, some dogs may fall off
Angle can be steep, and ramp does not attach securely to all vehicles

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has severe arthritis and needed this for our deck. We use this outdoors and I worried about the durability but not anymore. My dog has learned to use this and enjoys using this as opposed to our steps. The rubber on the bottom makes this stay in place. The surface is a gritty sandpaper so traction is good and it helps my dog’s nails. This lives outside on our deck 100% of the time. I will purchase again if the weather starts to get to the ramp. So far, so good on that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product. Light weight and durable
customer_reviews.text: Loved the quality and lightweight and durable. My 75 lb dog has trouble getting into my back of my SUV without help. This ramp slides open easily and stays put on the ledge of the back of my SUV. My dog walks up the ramp and into the back of the car no problem. When I first got the ramp I laid it on the ground inside overnight to let my dog get used to seeing it. I had walk down the ramp on the floor a few times so he could get used to it. Works great. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tex1945

customer_reviews.title: Pick me! Pick me!
customer_reviews.text: Zero assembly. Came amazing right out of the box. Works off the couch, on the back stairs, into the car, etc., etc.. Worth every penny if you need a ramp. Can run short or long. Super sturdy, blah blah blah. Got it for my dog who is in post-surgery recovery from TPLO. Can't jump on anything for two months, so I got this for him. You should get one too.
customer_reviews.author: crystal

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: Very stable ramp and well manufactured. I’ve been using every day for 7 years In harsh Chicago conditions year round and still working perfectly. Used with 80 and 60 lb senior 13-14 year old aussies. Vehicle is a Lexus RX300 and tailgate a bit high so slightly high angle. I compensate reducing ramp angle by backing up to a curbed sidewalk or other raised area. Also can be used with some front/back door sedans...if the door is wide enough to accommodate width of smart ramp. I wouldn’t hesitate to buy this ramp again if mine ever fails.
customer_reviews.author: nicholas ames

customer_reviews.title: Easy to store and use.  We consider them a necessary item.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second smart ramp. The first ramp was used for an older beagle. Then it helped with 90 lb. and 125 lb. Rottweilers. Now we have bought a new one for our newest family member, a smaller 55 lb. pup. These are absolutely important to help eliminate the trauma to dogs hips and backs ( especially bigger dogs ) from jumping in and out of SUV’s. The Smart Ramp holds up well. It’s easy to store in back of SUV. I definitely recommend this ramp. Should last for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Spanky

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit doubtfull about this ramp as I mainly wanted it to help my dogs get in and out of the car. we have a bigger aluminum pet ramp in the house that works great but it's big and heavy. Thankfully this one is light and because it telescopes into it's self it does not take up much room in the back of our car. Our dogs are used to ramps so they had no trouble getting in and out with ease, the ramp is quite sturdy and can even hold my weight of 200lbs. it slides in and out very easily and the non slip surface is very very good.
customer_reviews.author: Bay33saw

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to train instructions worked like a champ. Item is very light and sturdy making it easy to use on handed. We got tons of compliments using it when we paraded the big boys out at rest stops. Everyone wanted to know where we got it. The grid paper for traction is fine. No problems for babies. Also fit perfectly sideways in back to act as a barrier so they couldn't get to back widow.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Young

customer_reviews.title: My best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I think this might possibly be the best purchase I have made. Ever. We have used ours multiple times per day, everyday, for two dogs. We have used in rain, snow, slush, on gravel, and on various vehicles, and it has performed flawlessly! It’s durable, and it’s solid- this thing never shows any risk of movement, instability or sliding off the bumper while in use. It holds its position perfectly every time! 10 years ago, I injured my back from repeatedly lifting our 80 lb dog onto the bed and into the car. If only I had this ramp back then! Even though I originally bought this for our aging lab, our young lab uses it all the time, too!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle H.

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built ramp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my little girl who had trouble going down the steps because they were too steep. I've had it outside in the weather for four years and it's in as good a shape as when I first bought it. It's got some weight to it so if you plan on using it in a car it would be difficult, but for something like what I needed it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Les Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Slick texture
customer_reviews.text: Although the surface is textured it is still too slick for my dogs to walk up. They try and slide right down again. Unfortunately, I did not have an opportunity to try it before my window for return was up or I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: weelittlesprite

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Used Item was Horrible
customer_reviews.text: They said used, not with what lools like blood from the previous buyers animal on the tread. Item was heavily used with pieces missing and possible blood stains. This item is also very vehicle and animal specific, this doesnt fit every and any vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: d s

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, bulky, difficult for one person to use.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if there are better options out there, but I am not a fan of this ramp. It's very heavy and difficult to extend by myself (I am a 5'2" female.) It jams and pinches fingers when closing and opening. When closed/shrunk, it takes up all the floorspace in the second row of my CRV so you can't comfortably have a dog in the back and more than 2 people in the car with the ramp. Not sure I'll keep using it, but spent too much to give away. Dog acclimated to it fine, but not super human friendly.
customer_reviews.author: RustinoB1

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: Took some convincing with turkey lunch meat to train my pup, but now he is a pro at it. Makes me feel better and I don't have to worry so much about his hips. Only have had for a couple weeks, but happy with it so far. UPDATE: My ramp is starting to crack on the sides. I've only had it for 6 months and now that makes me furious. We never walk on it and it says that it holds up to 300 lbs. One dog weighs 104, the other 114. There should be no reason for this.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Knott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution!
customer_reviews.text: My closest friend & I both have large service dogs that go everywhere with us. Her dog often cannot make the jump up into the vehicle (SUV). This ramp is the perfect solution. It is light weight & easy to expand for propping on the back so the dogs can walk up into or down out of the cargo area (jumping down becomes a problem for dogs as they get older - hard on their joints & back). Easy to retract for storage in back seat area. VERY good quality ramp. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: Our fourth. We use multiple times a day every day for two large dogs. These last many years. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: J.C. & Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy ramp
customer_reviews.text: My dog was recovering from leg surgery and needed a ramp to get in the van. I read all of the reviews and chose this one because it sounded the most sturdy. This ramp is very solid. I was worried since my 11 year-old golden retriever is pretty anxious about trying new things. If the ramp had wobbled at all, I'm sure it would have freaked her out and she would not have used it. I was surprised how quickly she learned to use it. The ramp surface is also great -- it is like the surface of a skateboard, very rough so your dog won't slip. I highly recommend this ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: No more lifting
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is excellent. We use it attached behind the drivers seat (side door). You need a harness with a handle to guide your dog up for easier transport into the car. The ramp stabilizes nicely once you learn where to place it on your vehicle. We used it for 10 days camping in and out many times a day. It is a relief for the dog and for us as well (back saver)
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis M. Weis

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and easy to carry. space saving for storage
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and easy to carry . doesnt slip . my old dog weighs over 115 pounds. We are practicing with it on the couch and with lots of cookies. he is a little alarmed about going up it but hes afraid of stairs too, the issue is more the scaredy cat dog than the product. My other dogs enjoy going up and down it immensely since they too get a cookie and they get to go on the couch. They don't need a ramp though! I considered building one myself, but this is space saving, and has no sharp edges or splinters. i may need to put on some cardboard sides so big dog doesnt bail out half way.
customer_reviews.author: P. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: It requires a second grip other than the one I placed over the original sandpaper like base. My dog did not like the original base, so I purchased one similar to what is used on the ramp at the do-it-yourself dog wash location. I decided that even with the rubber-like overlay, she still needs more traction, so next, I plan to try an outdoor-type of carpet. It does require training so be sure you do that before expecting your dog to hop on and head into your car or onto the sofa, bed or?
customer_reviews.author: Tall Man Lake

customer_reviews.title: about a 100 pounds so I can't easily lift him in myself
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help my dog get in and out of my car due to joint problems. He is a large dog, about a 100 pounds so I can't easily lift him in myself. I have a smaller compact and unfortunately this ramp does not lay flat in my back seat with the door ajar. So basically my dog won't walk on it because he hates feeling unstable. More importantly, this is large and heavy making it tough to maneuver so using it on the go is difficult. It just hasn't met my needs which burns me because it was quite costly.
customer_reviews.author: barbara webster

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is so steep, my labrador struggled to climb it. Also, the surface is meant to grip, but it ended up really scratching her paw pads. Even though it was easy to get her to use it (treats and such), I prefer to let her climb into the back seat. A pain to get in and out of the car as well... Unfortunately, I did use it for a few weeks so it's all scratched up and I can't return it. Steps that attach the rear of an SUV are a much better and easier option than ramps.
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: This works well -- sturdy. It took her a couple of tries
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2014 Jeep Cherokee and a 100 lb Rottweiler. I wanted something to help her into the back of the Jeep. This works well -- sturdy. It took her a couple of tries, but she quickly got the hang of it. My only complaint is that it is large. I guess that's a plus in that it expands enough for her to easily climb it, but it does not fit in the back of the Jeep. So I have to keep it in the back seat which is not ideal obviously. I can make it fit in the back at an angle if she's not in the car, but it bangs around since it doesn't lie flat.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. A

customer_reviews.title: I think it will be great. Very nice construction -- I like the edges ...
customer_reviews.text: The ramp needs another surface to be non-slip. I cut some non stick carpet backing then put the strips on the ramp and it works perfectly. Yes, you do need to train the dog to walk on it -- so give it time. The ramp is light, very stable, and once my dog understands it, I think it will be great. Very nice construction -- I like the edges so the dog won't slip off. The edges are a different color which makes a good visual for the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Janet K. Gurtner

customer_reviews.title: Well made and lightweight but my dog simply couldn't scratch her way to the top
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight but I had to trade it in for a folding one with a rubber like surface with tread. My 30 pd dog had to be assisted up this thing as her nails failed to dig into this very hard surface. She left long scratch marks that a vacuum removed. Everything else about it is quality, and it obviously works for many dogs judging by the reviews....just not a mini golden doodle. I can't see this possibly working for an infirm dog. Edited: the rubber surface replacement ramp that I bought through Amazon is terrific and Tess made her way up it with ease the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Historken

customer_reviews.title: It is lightweight and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my retriever who has cancer in her hip and has difficulty walking up and down steps. So far she will only go on it very reluctantly if I take her on a leash and lead her up and down. Have not even attempted the car yet. My other small dog goes up and down with no problem. It is lightweight and easy to set up. I feel it will be fine once I've had enough good weather to be able to train her daily.
customer_reviews.author: shopperadvice

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, but not useful with our cars
customer_reviews.text: This arrived very quickly, thankfully. We wanted to let our dog get used to it before he has surgery. He weighs 95# so we can't lift him and hoped this would make it easier for him to get into and out of the car while he's recuperating. Sadly, the platform is too wide to fit against the side of either car, and he found it too steep for comfort when placed against the back of the Jeep. He might have done better if it had been carpeted (the surface is rough like sandpaper), but not wanting to waste any more time I returned this one and will have to come up with some other solution for the poor old guy.
customer_reviews.author: Vining

customer_reviews.title: Best ramp available!
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing all the ramps from Amazon, I chose this one based on reviews. This is an excellent ramp. It is sturdy but not heavy. We had our older dog walk on the ramp several times while it was flat on the floor. We then had him use the ramp up to a chair. Treats, of course, are helpful. Then, the big test. The ramp up to the tailgate of our truck seemed too steep. So, we lowered the back seats and positioned the ramp through the rear door. Success!!! He now goes up and down the ramp effortlessly. Treats, of course are helpful. Highly recommend this ramp. Marcus
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Dog ramp
customer_reviews.text: Great ramp! Needed something to allow our dogs access to our retaining wall hill. Our big dog could easily leap up, but as she's getting older we worried about her legs and hips and the damage it may cause. This was the answer. It took some time to get her used to it, but now she's up and down all the time. It's sturdy, and there's no slippage whatsoever. Highly recommend it. Our smaller dog loves it because now he can get up there without any help.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne L. Chudacoff

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, light, well-made pet ramp.
customer_reviews.text: A nice, well-made ramp. We use it so our senior dog can make it up and down from the couch. Sturdy, yet light enough to carry with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Soltura

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty heavy and kind of bulky
customer_reviews.text: I got this ramp for my 9 year old Labradoodle who is having problems jumping in and out of my SUV. The vet suggested it to protect his back. It's pretty heavy and kind of bulky, even when folded up. However, it's very sturdy, and after a few practices with treats, he goes up and down with no problem. If you want something that folds really easily and doesn't take up much room, this isn't it. But it does the intended job very well.
customer_reviews.author: J Williams

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Mr. Herzher!
customer_reviews.text: Fits just right on the tail gate/or bumper of my CRV - light enough to handle easily ladies - (Thank you!) - folds up with no trouble after a little practice on my part. Dogs need a little coaxing to adjust; angle of ascent, texture on ramp, "don't want to do what you want me to do" attitude, all needs OUR patience. It's clear to me that Mr. Herzher, or whoever designed this ramp, has/loves: a dog....a bad back...or a wife, cuz this ramp is perfect to ease all resistance! I for one am grateful I chose this one based on great reviews l read here.
customer_reviews.author: ReadBead&Tea

customer_reviews.title: Great Ramp
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our Mastiff puppy. This is a great ramp, easy to use, stable, and well made. This ramp is made for the back of an SUV, van or truck. If you try to use it on a side door you will likely be unhappy. We use it on our Ford Escape and it is great. We put it on the bumper and it stays put without worry about falling off. Some have complained that non slip surface is kind of like sand paper, but that is what nonskid is like! Ramp easily opens and closes and stores crosswise in the back of the SUV. Couldn't be happier with this product. Max loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Richman

customer_reviews.title: ramp for my Beagles.
customer_reviews.text: It's the only way to go for assisting your dog. Once they learn what it's for, they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick from Yuma

customer_reviews.title: Works for big dogs.
customer_reviews.text: The ramp works perfectly well and opens and closes without hassle. My Newfoundland puppy is a little skidish going up it but makes it up fine without any issues. The only downside is that it does take up a lot of room in the car. With two kids and the dog it ends up getting put in the back and the dog lies on it or around it. Big dog problems I guess. But it supports his weight (70 lbs right now and growing) so I would think anything under that would be no problem.
customer_reviews.author: N Plotkin

customer_reviews.title: Mr Herzher's long ramp
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure which ramp to get after spending hours reading reviews. I have a golden retriever puppy that would not be able to safely get in and out of the truck, so I needed a ramp. I started out teaching him to use it laying it on the floor than elevated it 1/2 way up the height of the truck. We finished our training session with the ramp at the back door of the truck. He flies up and down it and I don't have to worry about lifting him in and out. It is about an inch too wide for the back door of a Dodge Ram Quad Cab, but it does fit flat.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to train her by laying it flat on the ...
customer_reviews.text: This has turned out to work quite well with my 70 pound 13 year old lab. It was easy to train her by laying it flat on the ground for a couple of times before having her learn to walk down it, then up. I do have to hold her collar as she goes up but it isn't because it's not sturdy, but because she's not sturdy. The only thing I wish it had was a handle to hold and carry it. And if you're dog's stance is much wider than mine, this may not be wide enough.
customer_reviews.author: K10

customer_reviews.title: I bought two!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of your ramps after researching and deciding yours was the best One for my dog and one for my sister's dog. I was very disappointed when I opened mine and there was a rubber foot missing plus a random loose washer in the box. I have no idea what it came from and I am afraid that there might be something not put together correctly that could hurt my dog. I would like a response from the seller please.
customer_reviews.author: ansel ploss

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical about how sturdy this would be and if it would slide closed ...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about how sturdy this would be and if it would slide closed too easily, etc. I was happy to find that it is very rigid and well-built. It collapses to fit behind the front seats in my Pilot and even in my Kia Soul. I lay down all of the rear and middle row seats, and I can slide this in behind the front seats in both cars so it's out of the way of the dogs. I just pull it out of one of the side doors before using it. I use the ramp for two 100 lb German Shepherds, and it works perfectly. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Saves
customer_reviews.text: we use this ramp for our 7 year old 90 pound Golden Retriever, who rescued us. We followed the instructions and although she was initially a little uneasy, she now hops on the ramp and into the rear of our SUV. So glad we bought it, it has removed the stress of traveling for all of us.
customer_reviews.author: Callista Rasicot Tully

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ramp for all dogs and all situations!  In home and in car!
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered this ramp for a big bulldog to get into the back of the SUV/hatchback. He loves it and it makes it so much easier for all of us when we go to the park or out for lunch or coffee. Segue to the two senior dachshunds who discovered it in the house and it is the "go to" ramp for the couches and the bed! Great ramp for everyone. Lightweight. Easy to extend. Adjustable to the height of what you need to ramp. GREAT surface traction (so good in fact that nail trimmings have dropped off in frequency because the nails get sanded off!)
customer_reviews.author: Reads on Planes

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Herz knows his stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to get my over-weight border collie/black lab mix in an out of our Chevy Tahoe. It is quite a leap for her and with her weight issue its impossible. I was concerned about the price but after the first try I knew Ill never need to replace it. Sturdy built and easy to extend and fits perfect in the back of the Tahoe. I could probably use it with a hand truck as a ramp if its not too much weight and I'm very carful, I wouldn't want to wreck it, the pooch would be mad. Thank you Mr. Herzher for making a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Squatchn'

customer_reviews.title: This ramp has made such an amazing difference in my dog's life
customer_reviews.text: This ramp has made such an amazing difference in my dog's life. He's very large (a St. Bernard/German Shepard mix) with bad hips. We drive a minivan and can't lift him. He loves being able to get in and out of the car by himself. It's very sturdy (even for our heavy boy) and he doesn't slip on it at all. My only complaint is that it doesn't have hooks to make sure it doesn't detach from the car (I'm always afraid it'll fall). Overall, I think it's worth every penny we paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Juniper

customer_reviews.title: great for dogs but not easy to handle if you are short and single.
customer_reviews.text: this ramp can be difficult to close by yourself if you are short, single and don't have a lot of upper body strength -- no problem opening up. It took a few times for my 9 yr old, 60 pound dog to adjust -- but now he loves it and doesn't want to use steps! It is sturdy and has solid sure footing when your pet walks up and down. Works well on my Nissan Rogue tailgate.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne H

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: After checking out a lot of different ramps and stairs I choose this one I have a ten year old Golden who weights between 60 to 67 pounds and needs help getting in and out of the truck the Smart Ramp works great. Pro's no sag in the middle very well made easy to use just slide out to full extension and place on the rear bumper Con's Surface is slippery even though it has a not slip surface, I covered it with a piece of carpet and now it works fine. Great product you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: G.J.E.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this ramp my husband and I had just bought a travel trailer and needed something our 12 year old lab and 15 year old papillon could use to get in and out easily. This is perfect. Our lab weighs 85 pounds, but the ramp stays in place, doesn't shake, or look like it will bow in the middle when he uses it. The rough surface makes it stable for the dog to walk up and down without slipping even when it gets wet. It's simple to telescope down to a manageable size and is light enough to be carried easily. After I got mine three of my friends bought them for their dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Sutter

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: This ramp has been a life saver for my dogs. My truck is very high and they go up an down just fine. They would not be able to get into my truck without this ramp. It's relatively light weigh, slides open and close, fits right into the back of my truck. It also has a rough sand paper like coating that helps the dogs have extra traction. I love this Ramp!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Light and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This was a lifesaver for our family after our 13 year old Aussie who contracted Lyme. (News flash...turns out those drops are only 80% effective...back to pills!) She didn't like it (pride issue) but did just fine if I had her on the lead. I am too old and arthritic to be lifting her in and out of the car anymore. We have an SUV, so it works well. It would be difficult with a regular backseat door, as you need a straight shot.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cechal

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and big but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is very sturdy and works well. I find that the portion that slides down sometimes takes a few pulls before I can get it out. I would note that this ramp is heavy, and does not fold up small. If I put it on the floor in the backseat, no one can sit in back. Usually I fold down one the backseat in my SUV, and lay it in the back with the dog. But then I worry about it sliding into the dog. I would also say that it is fairly heavy, but very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: marie

customer_reviews.title: Works on our Jeep only at the tailgate
customer_reviews.text: Will work for our older dog but it's bulky to carry around in the car (though I'm not sure how you could make it less bulky and still strong enough to work.) We will likely make due until we absolutely have to use it. We have an older Jeep, and it definitely does not work with the doors. The dogs have to come in through the tailgate.
customer_reviews.author: kendrakw

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great ramp. Bonni, our dog, loves it. We have a four door, 4 wheel drive Chevy we tow our trailer with. We fold down the back seat for her to ride in. It's pretty high for her to just jump in so we end up having to help. Funny how when she gets excited or spooked though, how she just floats right on up there. She's a Bearded Collie, so...Hum? Anyway, this ramp has made life so much easier for us. Well made and light.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara  Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great for arthritic pets.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product and so is my Lab. He can ride again! He is an old boy 11 and having some arthritis issues. I did some research and decided on this product even though it was a little more costly. It is not to much of a problem but a handle on the side would be more convenient to put in the back of my SUV after use.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Ellen Hert

customer_reviews.title: I like and would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Once my dogs learned to use it, it worked great. One of my dogs (I have black lab mixes) will not get in the car without it. There are two minor drawbacks: first there is no handle to slide it out making extending it hard until you get the hang of it. I hold the bottom part in between my feet and pull up. Second it is large, so in my small SUV I had to put one of the back seats down to make it and both my dogs fit. That's only a problem if I wanted to take 5 people in my car. Overall I like it and would recommend
customer_reviews.author: tennisgal

customer_reviews.title: 12 Paws Approval
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is fantastic! We purchased this ramp after reading many reviews on this one and other brands. We have three senior labradors and at first (5 times) they were a little timid going up into the back of the SUV, without any problems going back down. Now they zip up and down no problems at all! The ramp slides out and back easily and it is not too heavy. This ramp is well worth the money. Good quality and price! Our 3 Labs approve with all 12 Paws!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kline

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: Can you believe it, made in the USA! It was only a few bucks more than one of the China made ramps. Nice construction, slides open easily. Fairly light (I think it is fiberglass) and I didn't notice any sharp edges. Took my dog a couple of tries but he figured it out quickly. We load into the side of a Honda Odyssey van so it works well, nice grade. Would recommend if you are looking for a ramp and want it to be made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: M. Chilli

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy ramp.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, sturdy ramp. I have no worries about my newfie using it to get into and out of the car. It looks and feels sturdy enough to hold her with no problem. The only problem is the pup, who simply refuses to step foot on it's non skid surface anywhere but flad on the living room floor. We're working on that. This slides together and is small enough to store in the cargo area of the Rogue.
customer_reviews.author: Solana

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with the Smart Ramp
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the Smart Ramp. It was the only one I found when searching numerous sites that has protection rubber on both ends that protect the surface of the vichicle; and it was no more expensive or was less than others. Surface is easy for my Boxer to use. Light enough for me to easily manipulate effectively. I would definitely recommend this ramp
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarie

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my service dog cause I have a Chevy Traverse so it was hard to get her in and out safely. She took right to it and its so much easier for me! Totally worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Good for an arthritic dog.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my small arthritic dog to go up and down our back step. It worked well for her, but it does get a little slippery when wet. Overall it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: mary herman

customer_reviews.title: Met our needs.  Solid and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Easy to slide and use. Met description. We wish it was a little lighter, but we knew what we were buying. Works just fine for our 50-lb mutt. There was one small pad missing...contacted solvit...they remedied immediately.
customer_reviews.author: PrairieFire

customer_reviews.title: Nice an Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for our 35lb Beagle and my Chevy Tahoe. It would work well for bigger dogs too. It slides open easily and is really sturdy while being light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Hack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Ramp
customer_reviews.text: Well built ramp with a good tread. The ramp works as advertised. It wont rust, it is plenty long (70 inches), it is reasonably light weight, and it is sturdy. I would definitely recommend it. My dog went right up it no problem. I would recommend spotting the dog on the way up and down because it is a tad narrow. If your dog has trouble walking he could potentially step off. On the other hand, you wouldn't want the ramp to be much wider. It is worth the extra cash to get one that you know will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Cedar

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp for dog with DM
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ramp for my 50# Siberian husky who has degenerative myelopathy. Stairs were starting to be harder for him because of his increasing hindlimb weakness. For a dog with DM, even minor instabilty or slipperiness in the ramp would have rendered it useless to me. But this ramp has worked out great, it's sturdy and doesn't move at all when my dog uses it. The surface gives him enough traction and the slightly raised sides give him extra security. He was a little skeptical at first, but I started him on it flat, then gradually increased the angle over a few days (of course, some treats helped too!).
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Ramp Up & Go
customer_reviews.text: I have a SUV and a dog who can no longer jump due to hind leg problems. This ramp has done wonders to get her in and out safely and return to the places she loves. It took a lot of treats to get her up the ramp the first time, but after that, she was ready to go. It is light weight and easy for me to set up and down and put in the back seat. This ramp has made a big difference in my dogs confidence and mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Mills

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a pet ramp for our RV and very high pickup truck We have two medium size dogs who have never used a ramp before. This ramp was perfect and very easy to use! The dogs had no issues using the ramp on the first time out. I am very pleased with my purchase and highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great dog ramp!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It is solidly made, sturdy, and does not bend when my (60 lb) dog goes up and down. I took the advice of another reviewer - use plenty of treats and start practicing on a solid, flat surface. My dog has started to really show her age and she has not been able to get in and out of the car for the past several months. And, going in the car is what gives meaning to a dog's life! Now she can ride with us again! The ramp closes up to a length that fits in the back seat easily. Good ramp - good dog.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndiana Jones

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this ramp even though my 14 year old Golden Retreiver will have nothing to do with it. He's suffering from untreatable cancer and just isn't himself. But I can see other dogs having no problem with it. We have a Ford Escape and we got the ramp to load from the back. The angle is not nearly as steep as pictured which is a plus. It's very sturdy and very easy to open and close. Closed it would fit nicely in an average trunk or SUV. Guess we'll add it to our stash for the next garage sale!!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ramp, but not super light
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ramp, well made, long enough for stated purpose (I use it with a small pickup truck whose bed is 40 inches from the ground, with the tail gate opened flat). It took only a couple of quick lessons with treats for the dog to get used to this ramp. It's heavy, which is what you want for stability and sturdiness, but if you can't lift much at all and are looking for a super-light aluminum ramp, then this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: LBPSlava

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality but be Patient
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and handy to use. Be prepared to be patient in training your dog. Don't start off with it in the car -- let your dog get used to it on the floor at home with treats, etc. My dog doesn't go up the thing but does go down (which is the most important thing to preserve joints, anyway). Doesn't quite fit in my 2006 CRV, so have to put it on edge on the floor of the back seats.
customer_reviews.author: PONDER

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my lab as he seems to have trouble jumping in my husbands truck that is pretty high. This ramp is exactly what he needed. I want to make sure I protect his hips as much as possible as labs are prone to hip displaysia. It was larger than I thought but not too heavy. My lab is a big boy so I wanted a ramp that would hold up and I think this one will. Only thing I wish it had is a handle for carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to help our Golden ramp up to our SUV. She was suffering from cancer and could no longer jump. Unfortunately, we lost our Golden to the cancer but know we helped her in those last days with this strong ramp. It is well-made and light. We kept it in the back of the SUV. The only issue is the sandpaper finish on the ramp. I would have preferred a carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Raggio

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it; dog, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Well, this was ordered for the dog, and we have been trying to get him used to it by putting it on the stairs in our house before we have him use it to get into our truck. Unfortunately, he won't go near it. Hasn't touched it. The cat, however, absolutely loves it and uses it any time he goes up or down the stairs. He also sleeps on it and randomly sits on it throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth T.

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to slide open and closed for me (a woman) ...
customer_reviews.text: We got it for our Newfoundland and he took to it right to it. Wasn't hard train him. It fits perfectly in our pathfinder with enough room for the dog in the back. It is easy to slide open and closed for me (a woman) and my husband who has lower back problems. We had a folding ramp before and it was difficult to handle but this one is easy. Highly recommended for people with large breed dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Mauria Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great product/ well made.
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. Thanks to Amazon Prime was deliver quickly and well packaged. It required zero assembly or instructions. The ramp has plenty of length to reach the back of a tall SUV. The ramp is very struddy and showed no flex with 100lb+ dog on it. Took a couple tries to get my two dogs comfortable going up it, but after a little work both are good going up and down. Much easier than lifting them in.
customer_reviews.author: Manacker

customer_reviews.title: Great for a few steps
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect thing to help my dog get down three steps (counting the top level) between levels of my house. On the way up he takes the steps; on the way down he takes the ramp. It did take a little training but now he does it on his own. I have the ramp extended about halfway so the top rests on the top step and the bottom rests a foot or two past the bottom step - that way it's not too steep for him. It's quite stable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and light weight
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built ramp. It is lightweight and I find it easy to use. It stays open when you want it open and stays closed when you want it closed. The surface on the ramp is non-skid and works. I did have a little more trouble training my dogs to use it than the advertiser suggests. But then maybe I just have stupid dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kingbird

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea But...
customer_reviews.text: We recently bought a SUV that was just too high for our 13-year-old Golden Retriever to jump in. So we thought this was a great solution. It extends easily and makes a solid connection on the SUV and the ground. However, our Golden slips especially going up the ramp. I'm trying to figure out a better solution for traction.
customer_reviews.author: Wisequacker

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. Still need to help my 125 lb ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Still need to help my 125 lb dog down it and up it. It's steep because it's a short length. Steps would have been a smarter choice for me. Because it's so heavy and the fact I still need to help him up and down, I just pick him up instead of going to grab this. It's just inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: JazzyNYC

customer_reviews.title: Dachs Travel
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and bought the longer version which turned out to be the right thing to do. I had no trouble using it to take my dachshunds to the vet in my Jeep Cherokee. Their backs will last longer (and so will mine not having to pick them up!). They took to the ramp with just a little encouragement. That included one who hates new things! It is sturdy and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S. Lidh

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just opened the box yesterday. No assembly required. I leaned it into the Tacoma (accessory cab, not the tailgate) and called our lab over to try it out. No problem. I think this will be a big improvement over the plastic step stool she previously used to get in and out of the truck. Best of all - it was made in the USA. I thought I would have to buy Chinese junk from Petsmart.
customer_reviews.author: Red Wing

customer_reviews.title: Nice ramp
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made ramp. Although, it is a little difficult to set in place for our Ford Explorer Sport Trac as we put our lab in the back seat. The door doesn't open out wide enough. It would work great if we had a rear door as shown in picture. Unfortunately, we put Sable in the back seat of both our Sport Trac and truck. Dog gone vehicle manufacturers don't think about our four legged friends when they design sporty trucks.
customer_reviews.author: Sable's Mom

customer_reviews.title: heavy and difficult to use when trying to hold a dog as well
customer_reviews.text: I think the quality of this ramp is good but it is a bit heavy to pull out and put up to my suv when leaving the vet's office while trying to hold onto her leash as well. She is a 145 pound mastiff so you can imagine she is strong and makes it a little difficult. I am still having problems getting her to walk up it right away as she seems to be a little bit afraid still and stands looking at it shaking. Once she decides it is ok she will just walk on up, get in the car and lie down. It is very sturdy and does not bend under her weight.
customer_reviews.author: lori7408

customer_reviews.title: super easy for him to get up the ramp now
customer_reviews.text: I have older lab mix - who had hard time trying to get up the ramp into sub...I folded an old yoga mat lengthwise - tucked one end under top end of ramp and fitted yoga mat on walkway part...works perfectly...super easy for him to get up the ramp now !!! Since yoga mat is so flexible and light and doesn't take up any space in your vehicle you do not need to try to permanently attach to the ramp.
customer_reviews.author: jan t

customer_reviews.title: Might be difficult to open; perhaps too narrow for some dogs
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a good ramp, although it might be difficult for some people to open/extend as it requires some strength + leverage to slide it out. My greyhound won't even look at it -- I don't think it's wide enough (even though he's very slender) -- so it has gone unused since we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Surasky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is so great! It's well made and surprisingly light. Once you open it up, which can actually be a bit tricky, it's VERY secure. When you position it on the back of your vehicle, it's not going to slide around at all! It is, however, a little bit bulky when I'm trying to transport both dogs and the ramp too. It's definitely worth the purchase if you need some assistance with your dog/s.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: great idea
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality. Only problem is that I let a friend borrow it for her dog and she likes it so much she hasn't given it back! My dog figured it out really fast (golden retriever) . It's really sturdy, but not too heavy to lug in and out. It fits in the back of my forerunner with plenty of room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: BoCPhus

customer_reviews.title: Ramp served us well for 3 years, really helped
customer_reviews.text: This ramp was able to get a 150 lb dog in and out of an SUV, very sturdy and really helped my dogs mobility. Was well worth the price, in fact it was one of those priceless items that helped me spend more time with my aging pup.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry Belov

customer_reviews.title: Best Ramp Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 100lb Lab and after a day of playing at daycare she cant jump into my car. This ramp is perfect! it is nice and light and very easy to slide out. When I first got it I layed it on the floor and my dog practiced walking on it that way, now she has the hang of it and after a rough day of play she easily can get into my car. Definitly a great investment!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Ivey

customer_reviews.title: Smart and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago I bought a ramp (the kind that folds in half). It was awkward and heavy, but did the job. This new ramp is so easy to use. It is lighter weight and slides so easily to open. Took a few treats and encouraging words and a few repetitions to train my new dog to use it. So happy after looking at all the different products that I chose this style.
customer_reviews.author: Jan C.

customer_reviews.title: very good product
customer_reviews.text: Well made, heavy-duty, easily held two separate 150-165 lb Newfoundlands. Took a little training to get them used to the idea of going on a ramp but that would be with any new thing for most dogs. I also once put it on the running board at my passenger back door so it was less of an incline and that helped. It is heavy but that's why it held my large dogs.
customer_reviews.author: SDC21

customer_reviews.title: Skinless...
customer_reviews.text: The ramp was purchased as a gift, and I have not yet received feedback from the recipient. However, upon receipt I noticed that the ramp, although strong and durable, was not protected by any packing in the cardboard carton in which it was shipped. As a result, one of two of the rubber pads designed to prevent the ramp from moving had already fallen off and was loose in the box. They should have been attached to the ramp with screws. The ramp was as described.
customer_reviews.author: Wallet Nut

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but heavy and still a bit slippery.
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is sturdy, but a bit heavy. It is not a ramp that you would take in the car with you. The non-slip surface is still a bit slippery when a dog is nervous their first few times using it and has their claws out. Our dog took about a week to get used to it. I would have preferred a more rubbery non-slip surface.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin, Kelly & the Boys

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Non skid, basically sand paper, was wrinkled, which would have quickly worn through. Rest of the product was satisfactory, but the bogs wouldn't have it, no matter how many times I tried to acclimate them to it. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: kpman

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy ramp for 118lb Rottweiler
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy ramp for our very large dog (118lbs). It works very well in the back of my VW sportwagen. I did end up returning it because it was slightly longer than I actually needed and difficult to fit into the car when fully compressed. It was also a bit heavy. Otherwise a very sturdy product. Somewhat tricky to extend and shorten because there is nothing to pull against (like a handle).
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Handy but still cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my basset hound cannot jump into my SUV (duh). I like it, accept it doesn't slide open very easily, so I have to wrestle with it a bit. Also, it's still too long to put in the back of my Lexus GX 460, so I have to leave it at home and rely on someone else to lift her into and out of my car
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B

customer_reviews.title: Ramp is great but car doors don't open fully
customer_reviews.text: The ramp is well made but the car door doesn't open a full 90 degrees, so you have to angle it into the back seat. This destroys the stability of the ramp. It's then wobbly and our dog falls off it unless we set her up exactly right at the start. Why don't car doors open 90 degrees anymore? (Subaru Crosstrek)
customer_reviews.author: Sally Cruikshank

customer_reviews.title: great ramp!
customer_reviews.text: After trying other ramps for my old dog, Ramos that didn't work, thus one was perfect. I use it for my Toyota FJ Cruiser and my old Ford truck. Lightweight, easy to handle, just what I was looking for. My dog is about 100 pounds and the ramp handles that easily...
customer_reviews.author: RJ Garn

customer_reviews.title: Good ramp for a senior ‘puppy’ with 4 arthritic knees
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm for our 80 pound golden doodle with bad arthritis
customer_reviews.author: Somewhere in the Barrens

customer_reviews.title: easy to deploy with a nice grip surface and no ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this ramp for loading and unloading my Siberian Husky and German Shepherd from the back of my 2014 Nissan Pathfinder. My dogs took to using the ramp very quickly. The ramp is lightweight, easy to deploy with a nice grip surface and no sharp edges. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good functioning ramp but surface treatment needs improving
customer_reviews.text: Bought this ramp for my Labrador retriever who has a back issue and can no longer jump into the truck. I like the telescoping feature of the ramp and it is easy to use. What could be improved is the ramp surface which has a sandpaper feel. My dog slides on the surface even though I hold her collar to guide her up and down the ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Pam G

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, we use this every time our boy needs to go by car. Our boy is 80 pounds and it's a bit to get it ready etc. but it's worth it, we don't worry about him hurting himself jumping. He's use to it now, waits for his ladder. He knows it's for him. This is sturdy and heavy duty, we are pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Simone

product_meta.title: PetSafe Happy Ride Extendable Dog Ramp - Portable Pet Ramp Extends from 42 to 70 Inches - Great for Cars, Trucks and SUVs - Durable Frame Supports up to 300 lb - High Traction Surface Design
product_meta.description: Give your best friend a leg up when you go on adventures together with the PetSafe Happy Ride Extendable Dog Ramp. The ramp lets you customize access so your dog can join you in your car, minivan or SUV. Unlike folding ramps, this portable telescoping ramp extends anywhere from 42 to 70 inches in length to reach a variety of heights. The heavy-duty ramp is made of fiberglass, giving it an ideal balance of lightweight design and long-lasting durability. The ramp weighs only 16 pounds but is tested to support up to 300 pounds, making it suitable for any small, medium or large dog. Designed to make life easier for dogs that are aging, injured or who just need a little assistance getting up and down, the ramp features a high-traction surface and rubberized feet to allow your dog to confidently walk up and down the ramp without slipping. Some pets may need time to become comfortable with a ramp before using it regularly. We welcome you to contact us for additional tips on training to get the most out of your ramp. PetSafe brand is here to help you and your pet live happy together.
feature_bullets: ADJUSTABLE ACCESS: Extends between 42 in and 70 in to provide your dog customized access to a variety of heights; ramp measures 42-70 in L x 17 in W x 5 in H
EASY TO USE: Simply pull to extend the telescoping sections; built-in grips make carrying easy and rubberized feet keep the ramp stable at any length
TRAVEL OR HOME: Versatile ramp helps pets reach cars, minivans and SUVs; can also be placed over steps to help pets walk up and down
LIGHT AND DURABLE: Rugged fiberglass construction is lightweight but stands up to heavy use; independently safety tested and rated to support pets up to 300 lb
SAFE AND RELIABLE: Textured walking surface provides traction and safety; guide rails on each side help pets feel secure
IMPORTANT NOTE: Designed especially for our four-legged friends; not intended for human use
MADE IN THE USA: These high-quality PetSafe dog ramps are proudly made in the United States
U.S.-BASED CUSTOMER CARE:  Let our pet product experts help; we’re available Monday through Saturday to answer your questions at 1-800-845-3274

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
